alert.note: Alert for Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 25 at 6:29PM EDT until May 25 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Gulf County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 930 PM CDT /1030 PM EDT/. * At 529 PM CDT /629 PM EDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in the last 4 Hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Port St. Joe, Jones Homestead, Ward Ridge, Simmons Bayou, Milltown, Highland View, Indian Pass, St Joseph State Park, Cape San Blas, Odena and Saint Joe Beach. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
